meanings.definition: To cover or stain with blood.
meanings.sent1: The hunter ensanguined his hands while skinning the deer.
meanings.sent2: The crime scene was ensanguined with blood spatter.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy chef accidentally ensanguined the kitchen with beet juice.
meanings.sent4: The battlefield was ensanguined with the sacrifices of brave soldiers.
meanings.sent5: The horror movie was so graphic that it ensanguined the minds of the audience.

meanings.sent1: The artist ensanguined the canvas with vivid red paint.
meanings.sent2: The horror novel was ensanguined with gruesome descriptions.
meanings.sent3: The prankster's fake blood ensanguined the Halloween party.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds ensanguined the sky before the storm.
meanings.sent5: The haunted house was so realistic that it ensanguined the visitors' imaginations.
